threepio.tabler
Class Tabler

java.lang.Object
  threepio.tabler.Tabler
Direct Known Subclasses:
ModelTabler
public abstract class Tabler
extends java.lang.Object

A Tabler converts a Document to a XTable, based on a user-defined or designer-defined list of columns.

Author:
jhoule

substitutes

java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> substitutes
a table of things to mirror, in case a column is missing for one, and they are similar. currently only used for names and bases.

Method Detail

abrevVersion

public static java.lang.String abrevVersion(java.lang.String vers)
returns an abbreviated version string for BBF documents, stripping off names, and leaving numbers. If it doesn't appear to be a BBF version, the passed string is returned.

Parameters:
vers - - the original version string
Returns:
the new version string

                                       java.lang.String model)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
gets the tables of the components defined in a document, that are required for the given model, with addresses like "IGD.FOO.BAR"

Parameters:
doc - - the document.
model - - the model to get components for.
Returns:
the list of tables for the components defined in the document.

java.lang.Exception - - when encountering a problem with a file.

parseContainer

abstract Table parseContainer(Doc d,
                              java.lang.String param,
                              java.lang.String paramValue,
                              java.lang.String MajorItemType,
                              java.lang.String[] orderedLabels,
                              XTable refTable,
                              boolean includeContainer)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
parseContainer parses a "container" XML body out of a Doc.

Parameters:
d - - the doc
param - - the parameter to identify the container by
paramValue - - the value of the parameter to identify the container by.
MajorItemType - - the type of item to make rows for.
orderedLabels - - the labels to use for rows, in order from most prominent to least.
refTable - - the reference table to use.
includeContainer - - wether to include the container element.
Returns:
a table of the information parsed.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - upon anything that would keep him from table being made.
